articles.content:
GREEN BAY, Wis. (WBAY) -- Authorities say the first employee to test positive for COVID-19 within the Brown County Sheriff's Office is a jail correctional officer. 
According to the Sheriff's Office, the officer uses proper personal protective equipment whil… [+1129 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: New Mexico woman, 105, who beat 1918 flu, has COVID-19 - KOB
articles.description: Lubica "Luby" Grenko was diagnosed on April 29.
articles.content:
The Gallup-born Grenko was born when World War I began, then she survived the 1918 flu before enduring the Great Depression and World War II.
The flu took the lives of her mother, Marijeta Kauzlaric, 28, and younger sister, Annie Kauzlaric, 1 month old.
